question: What to expect on your first visit to physiotherapy?
answer: On your initial appointment, your physiotherapist will sit down with you 1:1 and take notes on your injury. This will include when and how it occurred, how it is affecting you, and the goals you wish to achieve. After this your physiotherapist will complete an assessment which will include specific tests to diagnose your injury. Once your physiotherapist has discussed your diagnosis with you, together you will go through a specific treatment plan tailored to your goals.

question: How long are treatment sessions and how many sessions will I need?
answer: Initial appointments will be 60 minutes long in duration and follow up treatment sessions are 40 minutes. Every individual and injury is different and will require a tailored approach. Your physiotherapists will discuss your optimal rehabilitation plan at your first appointment. This will take into account injury healing time and your personal goals

question: What should I wear?
answer: We recommend you wear loose, comfortable clothing that you would normally exercise in. This will allow your physiotherapist to conduct a comprehensive assessment of the injury.

question: Do I need to bring anything to my appointment?
answer: Please complete the consent form prior to your initial appointment. This can be found online under our contact us tab. You can print this off or send it electronically. If you have any Xrays, MRI or imaging reports please bring these with you as it will help your physiotherapist in diagnosing your injury.

question: Do I need to see a Doctor first?
answer: No you do not need to see a doctor first. You can book in directly with us if you have a musculoskeletal injury. If we feel you would benefit from a medical review, we will advise you on this and with your consent also write to your GP.

question: Can I request a chaperone?
answer: Yes, if you wish a chaperone to be present during your physiotherapy appointment please let us know prior to your appointment so we can arrange this for you. Alternatively, if you wish to be seen by a female physiotherapist we can also arrange this for you with prior notice.

question: What is the cancellation policy?
answer: As per our cancellation policy, you will be liable to pay 100% of the appointment fee if you fail to attend the appointment or cancel within 24 hours notice.

question: How do I cancel an appointment?
Parking
answer: Free parking of up to 90 minutes is provided at the University of Portsmouth Ravelin Centre. Please see the centre reception after your appointment for a ticket.

question: Can I be seen at home?
answer: SCRX provides a rapid home assessment and treatment Physiotherapy service. Please fill out an enquiry form and a team member will be back in touch as quickly as possible.
